alert.note: Alert for Cass; Douglas; Gage; Jefferson; Lancaster; Otoe; Saline; Sarpy; Washington (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 19 at 5:58PM CST until December 23 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Iowa and east central and southeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight Wednesday night to noon CST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Cass; Douglas; Gage; Jefferson; Lancaster; Otoe; Saline; Sarpy; Washington
